Hello! I'm new here so I hope this is the right channel.

*tl;dr*
When making requests to `contacts/v1/lists/recently_updated/contacts/recent`, can I get the primary email of a contact by
• taking the *first* element of the `identity-profiles` array
• from this `identity-profiles` object, taking the unique element of the `identities` array with `"is-primary": true`
*Full Context*
I'm working on a HubSpot integration that makes requests to the `v1` legacy endpoint. In particular, I'm trying to access the primary email of the contacts in the response to `contacts/v1/lists/recently_updated/contacts/recent`.

The documentation for this endpoint is here:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_recently_updated_contacts>

In the documentation, elements of an `identities` array (in `identity-profiles`) do not have `is-primary` or `is-secondary` properties. Based on our legacy code, I'm guessing that:
• for each element of `identity-profiles`, only one element of the `identities` array has `type` `EMAIL`, 
• the first element of `identity-profiles` contains the primary email
• the subsequent elements of `identity-profiles` are the record's merge history
This isn't explicitly spelled out anywhere I can see though, e.g.
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/contacts-overview>

However, what I'm observing when I make these requests now matches what is described in
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/What-is-identity-profiles-in-contact/td-p/232911>
in that
• `EMAIL` type `identities` have either `"is-primary": true` or `"is-secondary": true`
• only the first `identity-profile` contains `identities` with `type` `EMAIL`.
When did this change? Are these observations correct?

I also posted this to the community forum because I'm a keener
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Primary-email-for-contact-from-v1-endpoint/m-p/391036#M38583>

I wish I could have this feature also, it would really help my company

You can't use that transactional email API without paying extra for the special license

You need to be more specific what API you called and give the full endpoint WITHOUT API key value and payload of error back

This is one of the best writeups I have ever seen posted about a HubSpot API issue, but sadly involves an API I have not directly used. My code is using the "normal" Contact APIs instead of the special ones that are applying the funky time filtering and sorting, and in these APIs there is one obvious email field to get the value from.

Is there a chance you can test your way out of this predicament?

By which, I mean, get yourself a dev/stage account:

<https://app.HubSpot.com/signup-v2/developers/step/join-HubSpot?hubs_signup-url=developers.HubSpot.com&hubs_signup-cta=developers-homepage-app>

Then after that make a fake contact which is manufactured to have recognizable foo-bar-baz-boo variables in the specific email fields which you configure in the various combinations, in addition to having two fake contacts get merged, which is another way of generating these kind of funny multi email records

After that then you will know, when it comes out on the API side, which item you put into which field, so as to disambiguate and know which one is actually primary

At that point then you will know fully how the sausage was made, so you have full control and get exactly what you want how you want it
